definition: a type of sea creature that resembles a flower
sentence: The colorful anemone swayed gently in the ocean current.

definition: not securely held or in position; dangerously likely to fall or collapse
sentence: He balanced precariously on the edge of the cliff.

definition: to find out or learn with certainty
sentence: The detective worked hard to ascertain the facts of the case.
The meeting felt interminable, dragging on for hours.

definition: causing annoyance, anger, or another strong reaction
sentence: The provocative article sparked a heated debate.
The pulchritudinous landscape took my breath away.

definition: feeling or appearing casually calm and relaxed
sentence: He gave a nonchalant shrug when asked about the incident.

definition: a manuscript or piece of writing material on which later writing has been superimposed on top of effaced earlier writing
sentence: The ancient palimpsest revealed layers of history beneath its surface.

definition: filled with bitter criticism or malice
sentence: The vitriolic comments on the blog post caused a lot of controversy.

definition: to show or declare that someone is not guilty of wrongdoing
sentence: The evidence was sufficient to exculpate him from all charges.
